pullrequest.title: Switch to six independent GPS sensor noise models

content.raw: I believe that the issue is ```std::vector<NoisePtr>``` can only be indexed by an integer ```x``` if it has been allocated a minimum of ```x``` elements, whereas a ```std::map<int,NoisePtr>``` does not suffer the same problem. The resulting behaviour is that with a ```std::vector<NoisePtr>``` we'd still need a strictly-ordered sequence of ```std::vector::push_back(...)``` calls, unless we pre-allocated the correct vector size in the constructor.  Perhaps I'm unnecessarily worried about developers getting this wrong. Would you prefer ```push_back``` or pre-allocation?
content.html: I believe that the issue is std::vector<NoisePtr> can only be indexed by an integer x if it has been allocated a minimum of x elements, whereas a std::map<int,NoisePtr> does not suffer the same problem. The resulting behaviour is that with a std::vector<NoisePtr> we'd still need a strictly-ordered sequence of std::vector::push_back(...) calls, unless we pre-allocated the correct vector size in the constructor. Perhaps I'm unnecessarily worried about developers getting this wrong. Would you prefer push_back or pre-allocation?
